page.title: 06Local History-Leighton Woods
page.content: Mr. Christopher Naylor of Leighton Hall was a keen gardener and forester. He first grew the quick growing hedging trees called Leylandii, or the Leyland Cypress, and it is a very popular hedge plant. {Ecology.} Here are examples of trees we saw in Leighton Woods:- Atlas Cedar, Field Maple, Japanese Larch, Black Italian Poplar, Nootka Cypress, Holly, Yew, Norway Spruce, Monterey Pine, Scots Pine, Wellingtonia, Turkey Oak, and Douglas Fir. {Birds} At a bird watch census study in 1970, 24 species of birds were found in this area. The goldcrest was the commonest bird-12%. They lived in the Redwoods in vertical territories. Other birds found were wrens,robins, chaffinches, blackcaps and chiffchaffs
